questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols operates without a port number assignment?

A technician is installing an optical drive in an engineering workstation that allows for optical media backups up to 128GB for each project. Which of the following drives should the technician install in the workstation?

discussion.content: LTO is no optical Drive, it uses a magnetic tape

I mean 
Capacity for LTO-2 Native is 200GB
Capacity for LTO-2 Compressed is 400GB

comments.content: Yes, but they said up to 128Gb only, no more. Therefore, BD-R is the correct answer here, BD-R (Quadruple layer) is up to 128Gb

discussion.content:
Capacity for LTO-3 Native is 400GB
Capacity for LTO-3 Compressed is 800GB

This is the specifications for current and future LTO generations
Specs LTO-1 LTO-2 LTO-3 LTO-4 LTO-5 LTO-6 LTO-7 LTO-8 LTO-9 LTO-10 LTO-11 LTO-12
Capacity (native) 100 GB 200 GB 400 GB 800 GB 1.5 TB 2.5 TB 6.4 TB 12.8 TB 26.08 TB 48 TB 96 TB 192 TB
Capacity (compressed) 200 GB 400 GB 800 GB 1.6 TB 3 TB 6.25 TB 16 TB 32 TB 65.2 TB 120 TB 240 TB 480 TB

so, the answer is C
Quadruple layer BD-R has 128 GB capacity.

questions.question_text: A user powers on a laptop and receives a message that it is under power. Which of the following should the user check FIRST?

A customer's laptop display has suddenly become very dim. The image of the display can only be seen with a bright, external light, as adjusting the brightness/ contrast controls does not cause much change.
Which of the following components MOST likely needs to be replaced?

discussion.content: The inverter is connected to the backlight and an important thing to replace. Often a dying or failing laptop monitor has a variety of visual effects. These are great to memorize as a tech so you can make a quick deduction. You don't every effect all the time but they're usually very easy to spot and identify quickly.

A. LCD panel: The LCD panel is responsible for displaying the images on the laptop screen. If the display has become very dim and adjusting the brightness/contrast controls does not have a significant effect, it suggests a problem with the backlighting system of the LCD panel. This could be due to a faulty backlight or backlight inverter, which is typically built into the LCD panel itself.
The inverter controls the lighting to the screen and provides power to it as well.
B is the answer inverter that need to be replaced
Contracts should be Contrast
